abstract: Shares opened sharply higher, with the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index pushing beyond 1,600 points, and the Dow Jones industrial average briefly exceeding 15,000 points.
snippet: Shares opened sharply higher, with the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index pushing beyond 1,600 points, and the Dow Jones industrial average briefly exceeding 15,000 points.
lead_paragraph: Investors who had been bracing for another rough summer were breathing a little easier on Friday after the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index climbed past 1,600 for the first time and the Dow Jones industrial average breached 15,000 during the day, both psychologically important barriers.

headline.main: S.&P. 500 Surpasses 1,600 as Job Gains Top Forecast
headline.print_headline: S.&P. 500 Surpasses 1,600 As Job Gains Top Forecast
